message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.AR 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on network function virtualization (NFV) and proposes an architecture for wired infrastructure in 5G networks. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the impact of backhaul/fronthaul configurations and VM inter-traffic on energy efficiency in 5G networks. 
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a mixed integer linear programming (MILP) model for optimizing the VMs location and VMs servers' utilization to minimize power consumption. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The MILP model developed in the paper can be considered as a control problem for optimizing energy efficiency in 5G networks. 
5. cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) - Although the paper does not focus on hardware architecture, the proposed architecture for wired infrastructure in 5G networks may have implications for hardware design.
